bug.author: KayDee
bug.description:
To get help from the community, we encourage using Stack Overflow and the <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/tensorflow.js>tensorflow.js</denchmark-link> tag. <denchmark-h:h4>TensorFlow.js version</denchmark-h>
1.0.0 <denchmark-h:h4>Browser version</denchmark-h>
Chrome 73 <denchmark-h:h4>Describe the problem or feature request</denchmark-h>
Codelab doesn't work as shown <denchmark-h:h4>Code to reproduce the bug / link to feature request</denchmark-h>
I tried the codelab. The functions shown there, i wrote them as es6 arrow functions. It didn't work as shown, the regression worked but not accurately (there was a big difference). When i checked the code, only thing different was the function syntax. So i changed it and it works fine. Any ideas why it does that ? because function syntax shouldn't make a difference

comments.comment:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/KayDee>@KayDee</denchmark-link>
I tried es6 arrow functions and it works the same. Can you provide your code snippet?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/kangyizhang>@kangyizhang</denchmark-link>
I tried arrow functions today and it works for me too Thank you for the help.
